ATEN IN WHITE OR WOMEN IN

BLACK.

During the next twelve months hundreds of

homes will ,he. caused worry and anxiety throngh

some member of their family having appendicitis.

Much of-this anguish could be spared, and manr

deaths," too. If people would do the one logical,

obvious, ., commonsense thing when symptoms

appear-call the doctor without delay.

So skilful hRs medical science become In coping

with appendicitis, thal a successful outcome Is

assured In. an. extremely high percentage of cases,

that is If the doctor is called In time. But

delay can literally mean the difference between life

and death.

ne of the most dangerous things about acute

appendicitis is that it. Invites delay. The usual

symptom is severe abdominal pRln. often accom-

panied bv nausea. It fools you Into believing the

trouble Is "only a stomach ache," and you may

be tempted to try to relieve It by home methods.

he first thing yon may think Is to take a

laxative, But If you hnppen to have appendi-

citis this Is one of the worst things you can do.

It may cause the inflamed appendix to burst.

Careful studies of thousands of cases indicate

that the two chief causes of. death from appen-

dicitis, are self-treatment and delay.

In reality these two causes are closely associated,

because anv attempt at «elf-treatment automati-

cally means that valuablo time will be lost.

So, remember, anv unusual or persistent pain in

,hr abdomen may be the beginning of appcndlrltls.

Don't take or give any medicine unless your

dorlor tells you to. And don't try to "work off" an

abdominal pain by massage or exercise. Call your

doctor at once.
